Title: Customizing Your Terminal: Adding Color and Information to Your Prompt
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video, we will be learning how to customize our terminal with dotfiles. In a previous video we learned about the difference between the .bash_profile and .bashrc files. And in this video we will be customizing those files in order to add color and information to our command prompt. In our next video we will be putting all of this together and exploring the real power of dotfiles, but before we get ahead of ourselves, let’s customize our prompt:

Title: Customizing Your Terminal: .bash_profile and .bashrc files

Project_desc: In the next few videos, we will be taking a look at how to customize our terminal with dotfiles. First, we need to understand the main dotfiles we will be working with, the .bashrc and .bash_profile files. What is the difference between these files and which one should you modify in order to customize your terminal? Let find out:

Title: Terminal Basics: Create, Copy, Move, and Delete Files and Directories
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video, we will be learning basic terminal commands which will allow us to create, copy, rename, move, and delete file and directories. These commands include: touch, mkdir, cp, mv, rm, as well as exploring some options we can use with these commands. Let’s get started:

Title: Python Tutorial: Automate Parsing and Renaming of Multiple Files
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video we will be writing a quick script to automate the parsing and renaming of multiple files. Writing quick scripts to automate boring and repetitive tasks is a great way to learn Python and it is a great way to save time. Let’s get started:

Title: Python Tutorial: Sorting Lists, Tuples, and Objects
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video we will be learning how to sort lists, tuples, and other objects in Python. We will start by performing simple sorts on a list of integers and then move on to slightly more advanced sorting using custom criteria. Let’s get started:

Title: Python Tutorial: Image Manipulation with Pillow
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video we will learn how to modify and manipulate images using the Python Pillow Library. Pillow is a fork of the Python Imaging Library (PIL). It will allow us to do many different things to our images such as: changing their file extension, resizing, cropping, changing colors, blurring, and much more.

Title: Python Tutorial: Using Try/Except Blocks for Error Handling
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: We’ve all run into errors and exceptions while writing Python programs. In this video, we will learn how we can handle exceptions in specific ways and also look at the control flow of a try/except/else/finally statement. Understanding how to properly handle errors will provide us with the tools to make better software in the future. Let’s get started:

Title: Python: Slicing Lists and Strings
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video we will look at how to slice lists and strings in Python. Slicing allows us to extract certain elements from these lists and strings. This can be extremely useful for stripping out certain values from lists or getting a substring of a characters from a string. Let’s take a look at a few code examples:

Title: Programming Terms: Memoization
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this programming terms video, we will be learning the definition of the term memoization. Memoization is a technique of caching results of expensive function calls in order to speed up computer programs when the same input occurs again. Let’s take a look at some code examples to get a better understanding of how this works:

Title: SQL for Beginners: UPDATE and DELETE – Modifying and Removing Records from Your Database
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video we will learn how to modify and remove records from our database using the UPDATE and DELETE statements. We will learn how to update and delete all the values in our table as well as updating and deleted specific values. Let’s get started:
